events.message: The customer reported an auto accident involving their vehicle on a rainy evening. They described the collision with another car causing visible front-end damage.
After reviewing initial claim details, the case was categorised under Auto Accident due to keywords such as vehicle collision and damage reported.
A claims agent with expertise in auto accidents was assigned to handle the case promptly to ensure timely resolution for the customer.
The insurer sent an acknowledgment email to the customer confirming receipt of their auto accident claim and outlining the next steps.
Requested police report, photographs of the damaged vehicle, and a copy of the customer’s driver’s license to proceed with investigation.
Customer submitted all requested documents including the police report, vehicle photos, and insurance policy details within two days.
The investigation team began assessing the accident circumstances, verifying documents and evaluating damages on the reported vehicle.
Completed the investigation concluding that the customer’s claim is valid and damage estimate corresponds with the reported accident.
A settlement offer was proposed to the customer based on damage evaluations and policy terms, specifying coverage details and payout amount.
Customer responded positively to the settlement proposal, expressing satisfaction with the timely handling and transparent communication.
The claim was officially approved following customer acceptance of the settlement terms and confirmation of coverage eligibility.
Payment was processed and disbursed to the customer’s designated bank account as per the approved settlement agreement.
The auto accident claim was closed successfully after confirmation of payment receipt and customer’s satisfaction with resolution.
All documents and correspondence related to the claim have been archived securely for future reference and audit purposes.
